intro: Vangueria lichenoxenos, commonly known as the rock fig, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and oval, leathery leaves. The plant thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its fruits are edible and resemble small figs, though they are not closely related to true figs. Vangueria lichenoxenos plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species.
